title: What are the different types of HP ProLiant Server? - Quora

response.answer_text: For average and advanced users, HP designed a rack server to optimize the user experience with unparalleled efficiency and performance. More importantly, HP has designed many stand-alone rack servers to better help individuals, businesses and workgroups. These rankings are available from HP 1U servers (HP 1U servers) that deliver the perfect performance for small and medium businesses and workgroups, all the way to HP 8U servers, providing the ideal power and compatibility features for complex and vast business environments. Our refurbished HP ProLiant Rack Servers includes some of the most innovative technical features we've seen in the server market. HP iLo management is only one of the features included in the ProLiant family. Also known as HP Integrated Lights-out Management, this feature is an in-line management feature that allows the server to maintain its full server lifecycle. Although most common on Gen8 ProLiant rack servers, this feature is just one of many features that we have optimized during the refurbishment process. HP 2U rack servers provide storage and expansion capabilities to drive business forward. Redundancy and reliability are features of the ProLiant family, featuring the DL380, the world's best-selling rack server, and the DL385,
